data.title: EventProfiler
data.body:
hey 
What do you think of an EventProfiler ? It just inherits from the profiler class (for now) to create a new class. 
The problem was that i had to somehow save the eventnames (if StringNames are used for the event IDs, that would be easier to implement), so i used a static HashMap ...

modified:

> // Object.h
> /// Register event names.
> struct EventNamesRegistrar
> {
>     static StringHash RegisterEventName(const char\* eventName);
>     static HashMap<StringHash, String> eventNames_;
> };
> 
> /// Describe an event's hash ID and begin a namespace in which to define its parameters.
> # define URHO3D_EVENT(eventID, eventName) static const Urho3D::StringHash eventID(EventNamesRegistrar::RegisterEventName(#eventName)); namespace eventName

and added 

> // Object.cpp
> void Object::SendEvent(StringHash eventType, VariantMap& eventData)
> {
> ...
> # ifdef URHO3D_PROFILING
> 
> ```
> Urho3D::AutoEventProfileBlock autoEventprofileblock(GetSubsystem<Urho3D::EventProfiler>(), EventNamesRegistrar::eventNames_[eventType].CString());
> ```
> # endif
> 
> ...

thats how it looks
http://imgur.com/NbPJfrY

data.title: Adding StringName class
data.body:
what do you think of a StringName class for Uhro3d ?

Description from [UnrealEngine](https://docs.unrealengine.com/latest/INT/Programming/UnrealArchitecture/StringHandling/)

> FName
> ... FNames provide a very lightweight system for using strings, where a given string is stored only once in a data table, even if it is reused. FNames are case-insensitive. They are immutable, and cannot be manipulated. The storage system and static nature of FNames means that it is fast to look up and access FNames with keys. Another feature of the FName subsystem is the use of a hash table to provide fast string to FName conversions. 

Open Source Ref:
https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/core/string_db.h
https://github.com/HeliumProject/Foundation/blob/master/Name.h
https://github.com/GarageGames/Torque3D/blob/master/Engine/source/core/stringTable.h

i already have an implementation of that. How must i change the default Urho3d license text if i modified the Name class from HeliumProject or the stringTable class from Torque3D for Urho3d so that i can upload it?

data.title: Add a Gitter chat badge to README.md
data.body:
### urho3d/Urho3D now has a Chat Room on Gitter

@hdunderscore has just created a chat room. You can visit it here: [https://gitter.im/urho3d/Urho3D](https://gitter.im/urho3d/Urho3D?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&content=body_link).

This pull-request adds this badge to your README.md:

[![Gitter](https://badges.gitter.im/urho3d/Urho3D.svg)](https://gitter.im/urho3d/Urho3D?utm_source=badge&utm_medium=badge&utm_campaign=pr-badge&utm_content=body_badge)

If my aim is a little off, please [let me know](https://github.com/gitterHQ/readme-badger/issues).

Happy chatting.

PS: [Click here](https://gitter.im/settings/badger/opt-out) if you would prefer not to receive automatic pull-requests from Gitter in future.

data.title: Text3D::SetColor with alpha == 0.0 cause crash
data.body:
Test files: https://github.com/1vanK/MyFiles/raw/master/SetTextColorBug.zip

It's reproduced only in one place and cause crash in Render() function

```
DamageLogic::HandleUpdate()
{
text3D->SetColor(Color(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 0.0f)); // CRASH!!!!!
}
```

```
DamageLogic::HandleUpdate()
{
text3D->SetColor(Color(1.0f, 1.0f, 1.0f, 0.1f)); // not crash
}
```

EDIT: click on scene

data.title: samples have visible shadow artifacts on mobile
data.body:
Running Sample 08_Decals on mobile device, there are visible shadow artifacts.
image1. displays normally. 

![240](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1681453/15037181/4a50df1a-12cb-11e6-8233-064415d5fae9.png)

When the camera moves closer, black squares begin to appear:

![241](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1681453/15037190/5ea7eecc-12cb-11e6-9267-44819bb7c9dc.png)

data.title: Add substring comparison. Improve StartsWith, EndsWith functions.
data.body: This should make StartsWith, EndsWith faster on very long strings.

data.title: Normal offset shadows
data.body: Normal offset bias for shadows http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1991.html is another way of combating self-shadow artifacts which needs researching. If the implementation can be kept in the vertex shader (instead of manipulation of shadow UV coords in pixel shader) the performance could also be acceptable on mobile devices.

data.title: Named pipe support
data.body: In the topic http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic2090.html a method of interprocess communication was requested. Named pipes would be one straightforward way to implement these, inheriting from Serializer / Deserializer. Separate Windows & Unix-like implementations are needed.

data.title: (feature request) Tags and variables inheritance in custom UIDefaultStyle
data.body:
For example:

```
    <element type="Window" style="BorderImage">
        <attribute name="Tags">
            <string value="Managed" />
        </attribute>
        <attribute name="Variables">
            <variant type="Vector2" value="0 0" name="StartPosition" />
        </attribute>
    </element>

    <element type="MainMenu" style="Window">
        <attribute name="Tags">
            <string value="MainMenu" />
        </attribute>
        <attribute name="Variables">
            <variant type="Vector2" value="0 -100" name="TargetPosition" />
        </attribute>
    </element>
```

I need both tags and variables for MainMenu element

data.title: Sprite does not send event E_UIMOUSECLICK
(Feature request) Automatic calculation of vars hashes when loading from xml files
data.body:
When I manually edit UI's xml file and I want to add a variable to UIElemnt, this variable is not loaded without hash. It's hard to compute the hash manually.

For example:

```
<element type="Window">
    <attribute name="Variables">
        <variant hash="1195757874" type="Vector3" value="1 2 3" name="test" />
    </attribute>
</element>
```

Var "test" is loaded.

```
<element type="Window">
    <attribute name="Variables">
        <variant type="Vector3" value="1 2 3" name="test" />
    </attribute>
</element>
```

Var "test" is not loaded.

data.title: Buttons can not be pressed on android
data.body: Touching buttons on android does not generate E_PRESSED / E_RELEASED events. Buttons light up though, as if they were hovered.

data.title: Demos in Urho3D master branch runs extremely slow
data.body:
Download the latest master branch, run the following:
 ./cmake_vs2015.bat ../build -DURHO3D_LIB_TYPE=Shared -DURHO3D_64BIT=1 -DURHO3D_LUA=0  -DURHO3D_C++11=1
then build the solution in VS2015, win7 64bit machine. When running the NinjaSnowWar.bat, it runs extremely slow (FPS around 20). Is it because of PBR is enabled by default now? Before PBR is merged it runs around FPS 200. And all other demos run extremely slow now.

data.title: Change deferred shaders to use actual world space
data.body: Currently the deferred lighting shaders work in a "camera-centered world space" which is confusing for a negligible performance gain. Since PS instruction counts aren't an issue as much anymore (no PS2.0 support), rather convert them to use world space.

data.title: Area Lights (new paper/code released)
data.body:
Hi all,

This recently got announced:
[Real-Time Polygonal-Light Shading with Linearly Transformed Cosines](https://eheitzresearch.wordpress.com/415-2/)

This could go well with the new PBR merge, and there's source code based on BGFX there.
